page.title: 08FISHERTON PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The central part of the school building built in 1872.In 1927 school was extended to give 4 classrooms and a hall.In 1930 when it was Junior Secondary the roll was 120.As a Primary School for children from 5-12 years present roll is 54 with staff of 3 teachers.The school provides a balanced curriculum for children from the nearby villages of Fisherton and Dunure and farms and cottages in the area with free transport for those who live more than a mile away.Apart from teaching and development of academic skills the school aims to help children towards an understanding of their environment and to provide ample opportunities for self expression. Participation of parents and community in school activities is encouraged at all levels including outings,sports and inter school competitions.
